p: The DENVs belong to the genus Flavivirus, which branched into four subgroups: (1) the insect-specific viruses that have only been isolated from various mosquito species; (2) the vertebrate viruses that have no known arthropod vector, and which have been isolated only from rodents and bats; (3) the mosquito-borne viruses; and (4) the tick-borne viruses ( Cook et al., 2012, Crabtree et al., 2005, Kuno et al., 1998, Uzcategui et al., 2003). It seems plausible that the ancestral flavivirus was a mosquito or tick virus that diverged by adapting to a variety of vertebrate hosts, including rodents, birds, bats, and nonhuman primates.
